page.title: 05Denmead's Church's History.
page.content: All Saints Church was built because the 600 people of Barn Green did not want to travel, any longer, the distance to the Church in Hambledon. It became Denmead's Church because Barn Green was, in 1880, only apart of the Tithing of Denmead. Barn Green has since been lost under shops. The land for the Church was given by William Griffin and the cost of the building born by several local landowners. Denmead became a seperate Parish in 1881 but did not gain a cemetary until 1917. A Parish Council first met in 1920 replacing the Vestry Council. A Church Hall was built in 1966. There have been 7 Vicars since 1880 the latest of whom is The Revd. J.R.Herklots M.A..
